column4: you can use FEBE to back up bookmarks, prefs, history, passwords, etc
thanks, i'll try and find that
FEBE + CLEO to backup addons and themes in a sinble xpi file
no themes, so no worries there. thanks so much for the resource!
i think that is what i just did tonight ?
what is your problem with youtube videos¿ '
they won;t play. when I open a youtube video, the firefox "locks up" (turns grey) and i have to force quit
the problem is ONLY with youtube videos
Ted.com videos won't play either, and some websites. i'm thinking its a flash issue
do you use (K)(X)Ubuntu 8.04 ¿
Ubuntu 8.10
did you have any other ideas?
i have 2, you could backup the important things in your FF profile, create a new one and import the important tho the new profile
the other is to use a Greasemonkey Script
i have no idea what a greasemonkey script is, but i'm pretty desperate
greasemonkey is an Addon for Firefox and Scipt are like little programs, to make the pages act diferent
i'll look into that too
for example i use this scriot to play youtube videos with Mplayer, instead of Flash> http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/38074
cool. so it overrides flash alltogether, then
and this is another script from the same author for youtube embed videos > http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/46219

i've saved both those. nice to have another option in case i can't make it work. frustrating that it DID work before, and now doesn't. i'm thinking backup and re-install the whole darn OS might be the best option at this point..
thanks for your help. i gotta run for the night, but i really appreciate it. if i ever get this figured out, i'll come back and let you all know. i appreciate the help VERY much.
